meanings.definition: The unit of inductance in the International System of Units, equal to the inductance of a closed circuit in which an electromotive force of one volt is produced when the electric current in the circuit varies uniformly at a rate of one ampere per second.
meanings.sent1: A henry measures how much electricity a circuit can store.
meanings.sent2: The scientist calculated the inductance in henries for the new circuit design.
meanings.sent3: The henry in the circuit was so high that it seemed to hum with energy.
meanings.sent4: Her love for electronics was like a henry, quietly powerful and always present.
meanings.sent5: The concept of a henry can be understood as a container for electrical energy.
